title: validators-external-signer-public-keys as a list
body:
# ðŸš€ Feature Request

### Description

When using configuration file, it would be nice to be able to set validators external signer public keys as a list.

**Exemple of wished configuration file:**
```
accept-terms-of-use: true
log-format: json
prater: true
<... other configuration ...>
validators-external-signer-public-keys:
- key1
- key2
- key3
- ...
```

Teku does support it this way.

When I try to do it right now, I have this kind of error:
```
time="2022-07-08T07:49:25Z" level=error msg="Mismatched type for flag 'validators-external-signer-public-keys'. Expected 'string' but actual is ''" prefix=main
```
Will try to take a look next week.
@nalepae Feature is added to develop, if you get a chance to test I'll close this ticket, otherwise I'll close when we release

@james-prysm do you have an example of how this could work?

With `v2.1.4-rc.0`, the previous version (with a string) does not work any more.

I tried different solution (with the list), and I always get this result:
```
time="2022-08-02 14:29:33" level=warning msg="No validating keys fetched. Trying again" prefix=validator
```

With, for example, the following configuration file:
```
prater: true
validators-external-signer-public-keys:
- 0x8001xxxx
- 0x804yyyy
- ...
```

If I use the former way (string), I get this error:
```
time="2022-08-02T14:33:50Z" level=error msg="Mismatched type for flag 'validators-external-signer-public-keys'. Expected '[]interface{}' but actual is 'string'" prefix=main
```
@nalepae taking a look right now. very odd error

@james-prysm It's quite blocking for me for the Goerli/Prater Merge, since I use Web3Signer (with about 500 keys for Prysm).

Please let me know if I misconfigured the keys.
I tried with/without `0x`.
With without space before each `-` item.
Maybe should I add `"` or `'`?

It works with `v2.1.3`.
It does not work with `v2.1.4-rc.0`.

@nalepae rerunning e2e tests right now so i can give a definitive answer.
i tried locally in develop running. with ` --validators-external-signer-public-keys=
"0xa2b5aaad9c6efexxxxxxxx,0xa2b5aaad9c6efexxxxxxx"`and it seems to be working
for the yaml file config i believe you need a space before the -
running tests locally right now to confirm

our tests are also running without the quotes I used i.e. `--validators-external-signer-public-keys=0xa99a76ed7796f7be22d5b7e85deeb7c5677e88e511e0b337618f8c4eb61349b4bf2d153f649f7b53359fe8b94a38e44c,0xb89bebc699769726a318c8e9971bd3171297c61aea4a6578a7a4f94b547dcba5bac16a89108b6b6a1fe3695d1a874a0b,0xa3a32b0f8b4ddb83f1a0a853d81dd725dfe577d4f4c3db8ece52ce2b026eca84815c1a7e8e92a4de3d755733bf7e4a9b,`

@james-prysm  I confirm it does **not** work on my side.
However, I use configuration file, not command line option.

My configuration file:
```
accept-terms-of-use: true
rpc-host: 0.0.0.0
grpc-gateway-host: 0.0.0.0
monitoring-host: 0.0.0.0
validators-external-signer-public-keys: 0x8001dae5feb4e12923d94bd0ec267e7bb9733d37ba96cda435b12ae4ebc278fd148b3c903280d0d56b8dbcfb998fb892,0x804fe32845ac9c3bd4c66d425908616a6cb3682b7c838273b1dcff3a7b73d369aa4b7c4fb7b6f41cc672456bda6b56d2,0x80c5ace9c54a4f22294f6ccbe37f1ee1655deba2912370440076a065b6e988340e7019193aecd05c031c85e1944e66a0,0x8131a00e218392773582a4b066d634b16e81f2c0a4d7f21dee6d3a23523fd6d403040bf1327744db89d0f752771bea0c,0x817ce8dddb61c5b5977df6e3f91bc97beb133cccd926b99f4b26ed544d9e25b43922d9b0d29a5a9e28f499a5bb378a8e,0x8190e874e3c06b715ff9eb17129ee690ac7f3542a93cdf07e9fd66739f82eb3c675829f7294790f5aec95c429c4309bf,0x81e55a6ab23fa3552f94966fa2c6a53a8b56269c01de244c0922603912b73291ce41cf116b528d58fbccfc662502eee7,0x8274d4d1099ffa1d503f66ddbc1900c6d9acc5a98d6ff6bf16b3445741afaa6daec6f516feed27948b9f9a4d9dd0206d,0x82a697b959e4b76b0e5acd93f982cf2862abcca0fdb17fef504a4546320f75edc4782cfa3fd6e4ad0c0a8f0d80cd652e,0x835a6a1cfc5996c885f39ed693e42518ba147aa0f557799db0318ead6034de47f11c5d4a1bfaca2de792f082119a29b5,0x837875a530008c112410ded2c6c9bf72945c639b1cf6106fad6f7d32bc3c9df4beafac7b3e39e01f22e883b5cda6a46c,0x839452c4ec9792d4e7fd03625db79c28ab83ba6c769cd550f8ed8774fc466c7104745f107e75f3bf2687b06cb443aa05,0x83fb0063283b032443d4e31b542abeab278db5616a5a69bd378e1ad808baa02ece73b1303f7ff97c3952e844c5372bb1,0x841e41d9c42ec738259176e7a32f041096aee878be09f03a217780792ceedf4f8d5a891b60d5eacbeccbb22e21931d47,0x84485cd267df5df159fdc83a444991c3d8b46f01acd7a4e0060cd4dff8dcfa5a71fddedf2a7972a080a4b18602380e2d,0x849de24c59751fe37add2da7d77ba713016f2d9f8095091a0f9fac5bb53ae2480c867e13b3e5a68760d4d8fcecf8a189,0x8519250b12647cc839e09a9f196bc60c8605548605e32aa6e78b4af093b3b54e3c9ae5010a23f33e131b859ca2decbe4,0x8534ed78319627857c2c5d2dddea9d966b0b8db343ec852413a586a68dac141e3e0af2c9533f68a34094c8c510b3c614,0x8536abb6ab90b0d60561060b5f8e9532c2c45e38c2db33b14836c429335fbcd2d476f0a39ff3f5aaca514797737ebf02,0x8554254f04cdbc9a51f70f0f20bd695b3bea7db13529960a46e9f1ecfd7525c9504ca4e3b6beb5af94dd57fcd68d56a5,0x859193d3a99b9e9666374035efa1dd6a508b0968bc6689eb4fb627ad2e74976713cb9c6f64ccb6c632d18c814c567235,0x85c6c09da922f3e99c4004cec151c44c2724c9c99dd518d56b479ee685d97bfd74dbb1a9e2e4a38075b3a5c83885bdda,0x85f8dc11b83532e90ea701f626b3a54a5b674d16f28b66aef5ac1ced3e77027889673fb5bceab2260cfdb90448ff5f8d,0x861a513b3c0ce14bafca00689ca456b9aecf36305467f813b9fa7d29f523ef8dcc2dca12e4784ee28bba0bfa58c3d091,0x86659a9ef84f85fdb70b071755ebef7e606a371455bfeb637aa7cff91afe4cc6d1bb70bf33316993e4031e80d119e8e3,0x86a15afa155e1e686a7604f18f95358ffd058a0d3bea13b8e8189114c16438b90aca34b081ffcf0120ed67202212b954,0x86dc357aa692680ca116c3dcb2c52721326f2bb2630881771a5a82e9ddbc8d9391528ac1f37f38857fc81da3aa385cff,0x86f6120761032dbf16267fda0ee6612e215718a012a883dec82a6b3fd121dcf3905c5f3e12fb314008da6c28cd722c3b,0x87347646e01289633a0650060aba1c85e2515d28ff01846c693f9159d7e67b0cf56472015468bfa6928bb58f86990b0b,0x873591ae746902f267b5e6929b5ce8e3f880e2f3113252cce992c9b777062ff03b0e5b1621f65a7faef4ad9669be6ed9,0x873a822386e041c186755a70cffd61bd17b4650a56e1091ba3bd648c54c...
```

The error:
```
time="2022-08-02T15:03:25Z" level=error msg="Mismatched type for flag 'validators-external-signer-public-keys'. Expected '[]interface{}' but actual is 'string'" prefix=main
```

And I still confirm it works well with `v2.1.3`, not with `v2.1.4-rc.0`

but something like
```
validators-external-signer-public-keys:
 - 0x8001xxxx
 - 0x804yyyy
 - ...
```
should also work with the space in front

@nalepae can you also try with brackets if you think the dashes are not working?
```
validators-external-signer-public-keys: [0x8001dae5feb4e12923d94bd0ec267e7bb9733d37ba96cda435b12ae4ebc278fd148b3c903280d0d56b8dbcfb998fb892,0x804fe32845ac9c3bd4c66d425908616a6cb3682b7c838273b1dcff3a7b73d369aa4b7c4fb7b6f41cc672456bda6b56d2]
```

With the list version, here is my configuration file (with the space before `-`):
```
config.yaml:
----
accept-terms-of-use: true
rpc-host: 0.0.0.0
grpc-gateway-host: 0.0.0.0
monitoring-host: 0.0.0.0
beacon-rpc-gateway-provider: goerli-prysm-beacon-0.goerli-prysm-beacon.ethereum-common:3500
beacon-rpc-provider: goerli-prysm-beacon-0.goerli-prysm-beacon.ethereum-common:4000
datadir: /data/db
enable-doppelganger: false
graffiti: Kiln
log-format: text
prater: true
validators-external-signer-public-keys:
 - 0x8001dae5feb4e12923d94bd0ec267e7bb9733d37ba96cda435b12ae4ebc278fd148b3c903280d0d56b8dbcfb998fb892
 - 0x804fe32845ac9c3bd4c66d425908616a6cb3682b7c838273b1dcff3a7b73d369aa4b7c4fb7b6f41cc672456bda6b56d2
validators-external-signer-url: http://goerli-web3signer.ethereum-web3signer:9000
```

And I get 
```
time="2022-08-02 15:09:38" level=warning msg="No validating keys fetched. Trying again" prefix=validator
```

I'm gonna try the json like way.

Same result with:
```
config.yaml:
----
accept-terms-of-use: true
rpc-host: 0.0.0.0
grpc-gateway-host: 0.0.0.0
monitoring-host: 0.0.0.0
beacon-rpc-gateway-provider: goerli-prysm-beacon-0.goerli-prysm-beacon.ethereum-common:3500
beacon-rpc-provider: goerli-prysm-beacon-0.goerli-prysm-beacon.ethereum-common:4000
datadir: /data/db
enable-doppelganger: false
graffiti: Kiln
log-format: text
prater: true
validators-external-signer-public-keys: [0x8001dae5feb4e12923d94bd0ec267e7bb9733d37ba96cda435b12ae4ebc278fd148b3c903280d0d56b8dbcfb998fb892, 0x804fe32845ac9c3bd4c66d425908616a6cb3682b7c838273b1dcff3a7b73d369aa4b7c4fb7b6f41cc672456bda6b56d2]
validators-external-signer-url: http://goerli-web3signer.ethereum-web3signer:9000
```
@nalepae can we try to isolate this issue? what happens with only 1 key value?

> @nalepae can we try to isolate this issue? what happens with only 1 key value?

OK I'll try.
Meanwhile, I tried with the command line, instead of the config file:

```
--config-file=/config/config.yaml --validators-external-signer-public-keys=0x8001dae5feb4e12923d94bd0ec267e7bb9733d37ba96cda435b12ae4ebc278fd148b3c903280d0d56b8dbcfb998fb892,0x804fe32845ac9c3bd4c66d425908616a6cb3682b7c838273b1dcff3a7b73d369aa4b7c4fb7b6f41cc672456bda6b56d2
```

and it works well.

Now with this all following configuration files, I get this result:
```
time="2022-08-02 15:25:08" level=warning msg="No validating keys fetched. Trying again" prefix=validator
```

The tried conf files:

**Without space before `-`**
```
log-format: text
prater: true
validators-external-signer-public-keys:
- 0x8001dae5feb4e12923d94bd0ec267e7bb9733d37ba96cda435b12ae4ebc278fd148b3c903280d0d56b8dbcfb998fb892
validators-external-signer-url: http://goerli-web3signer.ethereum-web3signer:9000
```

**With 1 space before `-`**
```
log-format: text
prater: true
validators-external-signer-public-keys:
 - 0x8001dae5feb4e12923d94bd0ec267e7bb9733d37ba96cda435b12ae4ebc278fd148b3c903280d0d56b8dbcfb998fb892
validators-external-signer-url: http://goerli-web3signer.ethereum-web3signer:9000
```

**With 2 spaces before `-`**
```
log-format: text
prater: true
validators-external-signer-public-keys:
  - 0x8001dae5feb4e12923d94bd0ec267e7bb9733d37ba96cda435b12ae4ebc278fd148b3c903280d0d56b8dbcfb998fb892
validators-external-signer-url: http://goerli-web3signer.ethereum-web3signer:9000
```

**JSON like**
```
log-format: text
prater: true
validators-external-signer-public-keys: [0x8001dae5feb4e12923d94bd0ec267e7bb9733d37ba96cda435b12ae4ebc278fd148b3c903280d0d56b8dbcfb998fb892]
validators-external-signer-url: http://goerli-web3signer.ethereum-web3signer:9000
```
As I see right now, only the command-line-string-version seems to work.
I'll go investigate this further, please use this workaround in the meantime I'll update when I can.
I was able to recreate this but still in the process of identifying root cause
@nalepae I believe I may have found the reason this is happening, I am still in the process of testing different cases. I apologize for the distruption this caused you and will try to fix this ASAP.

Thank you for your investigation!

For information as a workaround I modified my Helm charts so that all keys are given as a big string to the command line option. It is not very elegant but at least it works ;)
hi @james-prysm is this resolved?

> hi @james-prysm is this resolved?

Yes this should be resolved but it's not released yet.
I was waiting for @nalepae to return from OOO before closing.
Is there a Docker image where I can test it?
@nalepae I think you can get it from here https://hub.docker.com/r/prysmaticlabs/prysm-validator/tags changes are in develop. we are releasing v3 next week so you can also wait for that.

Same issue in v2.1.4.           
v3.0.0 works well.
going to close this now that v3.0.0 works
It works, thanks!

Just for general information.
I tried the same with v4, and `validators-external-signer-public-keys` has to be a YAML list, not a string.
